intro: Brachystelma petraeum, commonly known as the rock lily, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. This succulent plant is characterized by its fleshy, cylindrical stems and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and white. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid environments. Brachystelma petraeum is often found growing on limestone outcrops and in mountainous regions.
